title: Raymond Charles Sanford - Birth & Early Life
description: Born July 31, 1943 in Ketchikan, Alaska to Charles Vernon Sanford and Agnes Dora Albin Sanford, he spent his early years in the Pacific Northwest before answering the nation's call to service.

title: Joined the United States Coast Guard
description: At age 17, Raymond Sanford enlisted in the Coast Guard and began a distinguished 26-year career, ultimately serving as Chief Warrant Officer 4 in both operational and technical billets.

title: Retired from the United States Coast Guard (CWO4)
description: Sanford retired in 1986 after more than two decades of service, including time conducting international radar maintenance and training on advanced air defense systems.

title: Criminal Analyst - Vacaville, California
description: Following military retirement, he joined local law enforcement in Vacaville researching major case evidence, building analytical models, and supporting investigations with technical precision.

title: Criminal Analyst - Clayton County, Georgia
description: Raymond Sanford brought his analytical expertise to Clayton County, supporting regional investigations with a deep background in signal intelligence and evidence validation.

title: Raymond Charles Sanford - Memorial
description: Mr. Raymond Charles Sanford, age 81 of Griffin, passed away on Monday, January 6, 2024 at his residence.

title: Gotcha Report - Probing Tests Seeded
description: An artifact documenting initial negative tests and the gotcha-harness used to detect validation quirks.

title: Angular Full Stack Web Developer at Apex Systems
description: Worked on a U.S. Army Corps of Engineers project to build Angular front-end applications integrated with a new SharePoint system, supporting business operations and reporting modernization. My role centered on UI development and integration support, contributing to federal data governance and analytics initiatives. â€¢ Created modern, responsive user interfaces leveraging Angular Material 14+ and RxJS Observables for real-time interactivity. â€¢ Supported development of Angular applications connected to the new SharePoint backend, ensuring smooth data access and usability in a complex federal environment. â€¢ Assisted with modernization of reporting tools using Excel, CSV, and JSON sources. â€¢ Collaborated in an Agile environment, contributing to data governance and analytics initiatives. â€¢ Recognized for energy, adaptability, and problem-solving while working on SharePoint-based systems. CODE: Angular, Angular Material, RxJS, CSS/SCSS, SharePoint (REST API, JSON), Power Apps, Azure DevOps, Git, Agile/Scrum

title: Full Stack Web Developer - Lead at Booz Allen Hamilton
description: Lead the development and implementation of secure, scalable web applications for the Department of Veterans Affairs. Spearheaded research and documentation initiatives and fostered strong cross-team collaborations to enhance data processing workflows with federal agencies. â€¢ Research and Documentation: Researched and documented the use of federal tax information at the Department of Veterans Affairs, from remote end users at regional medical centers, through data centers, and their eventual use on mainframes to be processed with the Internal Revenue Service (IRS) and Social Security Administration (SSA). â€¢ Cross-Team Collaboration: Developed and cultivated cross-team relationships, establishing communication channels between the Office of Information Technology (VA OIT) and the IRS/SSA. â€¢ Prototyping and Security: Used traditional RESTful models, Apache Kafka, Kubernetes, and various security services to create several prototypes of data at rest and in-flight. CODE: Java Spring Boot, JPA, NestJS, Angular, Playwright, TDD/BDD, Material, D3JS, Apache Kafka, Oracle Database, IBM Control-M, Connect:Direct

title: Full Stack Web Developer - Lead at Business Integra Inc
description: As the lead developer at the Defense Technical Information Center (DTIC), I played a pivotal role in modernizing the platform that records all government grants and research projects. â€¢ NIST RMF Training and Compliance: Completed extensive training in the NIST Risk Management Framework (RMF) and ensured strict adherence to auditing, security, privacy, and testing controls. â€¢ Modernization of Web Applications: Directed the front-end development (as a team of one) to create a modern Angular Material website for DTIC, streamlining the process of tracking publications through various stages. â€¢ Library Creation: Built reusable libraries to support common table and form development, ensuring consistency and scalability for future projects. CODE: Angular 10, Material Design, Tables, Forms, Libraries, Java Spring Boot, Azure

title: Full Stack Web Developer at Accenture
description: Designed and developed a fully tested Angular web application using aggregated data in a mongo database to provide complex and beautiful data visualizations supporting Defense Logistics Agency mission of logistics support for the Department of Defense. â€¢ Created user and group application entity authentication. â€¢ Management of sprint team with 2-5 junior developers. â€¢ Training Angular, D3 Data Visualization Concepts, RXJS and Typescript concepts. â€¢ Created mock-ups, prototypes, developer and production environments (DEVOPS) and testing environments. CODE: Angular 1.7, 4, 8, 10, Angular Libraries, LESS/SCSS, Material Design and Theming, RXJS, Typescript, 100% tested (TDD)

title: Web Developer at Digital Product Company
description: â€¢ Provided web development consulting services to a digital design agency. â€¢ Created mockups of new designs, prototypes of web application and production code. â€¢ Created applications in the Python for collection of statistics and presentation on a dashboard written in Node/TYPESCRIPT. â€¢ Designed and developed a quote and purchase application using TDD that allows for conversion from client excel formulas to a modern web application. CODE: HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript ES6+, React, Typescript, NodeJS, Python, Grunt, Mocha

title: Front End Web Developer at Digital Product Company
description: â€¢ Styling and markup changes in Angular JS and WordPress for a large public web application. â€¢ Wrote models and controllers for back-end in PHP5/CodeIgniter. CODE: HTML5, CSS3, WordPress, JavaScript, LESS, Ruby, AngularJS (1+)

title: JavaScript Developer at Web Application Company
description: â€¢ Produced a site-wide testing and activity application using JavaScript and PhantomJS. â€¢ Styling and markup for global and page templates. CODE: HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript ES5+, NodeJS, Redis, ColdFusion

title: Web Development and Design at Magic Coffee Truck
description: Initial site design using HTML5/CSS3 and Bootstrap to create a responsive, mobile-friendly landing page. Implemented PHP and JavaScript(JQuery and AngularJS) technologies for form submissions and additional site features. Creation of Bloom (www.magiccoffeetruck.com/bloom) in Wordpress. Designed and launched MailChimp e-mal campaign.

title: Lead Designer and Developer at Imagine Create Thrive
description: Providing contractual consulting to home users and businesses in the Denver area in installation, maintenance and repair of Windows desktops. Occasional projects included graphic and web design, content writing and product demonstrations.

title: Internship in Web Design and Development at POSIgnite
description: Responsibilities include front wen development and design in a PHP CodeIgniter framework. Exposure and designs in HTML5/CSS3, Bootstrap, AngularJS, PyroCMS.

title: Network Operations at BAX Global
description: Initially contracted to convert network devices and systems to new IP network. Contract was extended to include helpdesk duties support Windows XP customer on a global network. Provided point of contact for network and data-center issues. Supported UNIX and AIX system in basic administration and functionality.

title: Network Operations/Technical Support at Ricochet Networks
description: Provided all levels of technical support from Windows 98SE through Vista and Macintosh operating systems while maintaining 90% up time on wireless network systems. Additional duties included equipment inventory, billing, technical documentation of process and shipping.

title: IT Analyst / Desktop Support at Pioneer National Resources, Inc
description: Contracted to provided desktop support for Windows XP/Citrix based network on a part-time basis for a current employee's 6-week leave. Provided exceptional support for imaging scanners, copiers and large HP plotters as well as desktop, network and server operations. Implemented documentation and processes in both helpdesk and internal resources through Remedy and publications. Project extended to full-time contract to include network discovery and isolation of system outage incidents.

title: Technical Support at Southwest CyberPort
description: Provided all levels of technical support to internet customers locally in Albuquerque, New Mexico. Support included dial-up, DSL, web hosting and other network/internet related services.

title: Sales/Technical Support at ClientLogic
description: Initially provided sales and account registration. Promoted to technical support for PeoplePC dial-up internet services. Excellence in customer relations. Exceed sales quota regularly and provide excellent technical support in Windows 95 through XP.

title: Technical Support Representative at FedEx
description: Provided telephonic technical support for Windows 98SE through XP/2000. Technical support and training for users and managers utilizing network terminal, scanners, printers, Citrix ICA remote desktops and CISCO VPN users. Additional duties included training team on usage of Remedy and call tracking technologies.

title: WinFrame Administrator at Presbyterian Healthcare
description: Successfully planned and implemented a multi-user Citrix WinFrame network environment to provide remote dial-in procedures and applications for a 50-user base of Medical Transcriptions. Developed training agenda and personally trained all departments in proper support procedures for the new window-based system. Took responsibility in supporting end user issues relating to modem connectivity and performance, profiles, user directories and specific user files common in the multi-user environment.

title: Lotus Notes Administrator at McAfee (Network Associates)
description: Initially contracted to provide testing for current McAfee software solutions. Promoted to Lotus Notes Administrator to provide testing virus detection software in the Notes environment. Planned and implemented testing matrix and project plan for detection and cleansing of e-mail and user files infected with viri.

title: Technical Support Engineer at Network Computing Devices, Inc
description: Provide technical support to network administrator Multi-user NT environment. Technical support included a large customer base of diverse LAN/WAN environments with strong emphasis on XDM connectivity, and client/server models. Reproduced and wrote bug reports for engineering staff. Provided initial testing and documentation of modem connectivity within the multi-user environment.

title: Development Manager at Teleport Internet Services
description: Management of four Tier III support members in the Macintosh and IBM computer platforms. Trained staff in basic and advanced topics related to computer Internet support. Responsible for creation, testing and release of the Teleport Internet Starter package, which included Internet software for Macintosh, Windows 3.x and Windows 95 platforms. Additional duties included "last-stop" technical support for advanced Internet issues. Oversaw timely update of management, staff, and user base with majordomo, newsgroups, email, and briefings. Creation of on-line helpfiles for current situations and topics.

title: HAWK Radar Technician at U.S. Army
description: Calibration, maintenance, troubleshooting, and repair procedures for the ICWAR and IHIPAR air defense radar systems. Trained in advanced diagnostic usage of test equipment for on-site and in-shop repair of chassis and system malfunctions. Additional duties included responsibilities for updating, indexing and secure storage of classified and secret radar system manuals for section in Germany and entire battery at WSMR (LC-32). Honorably discharged from WSMR.

title: Associate of Arts and Sciences (AAS), Computer Programming and Systems Design at American Business & Technology University
description: Grade: 3.8 GPA

title: 24K1R - Improved HAWK Continuous Wave Radar Repairman, RF Engineering at US Army Missile and Munitions School, Redstone
description: Grade: Top of Class. Activities and societies: Non Commissioned Officers Association
